programme.title: Norman... Is That You?
programme.desc: Parents (Redd Foxx, Pearl Bailey) discover their son is gay and lives in Hollywood with his white lover (Dennis Dugan).

programme.title: Greased Lightning
programme.desc: World War II veteran Wendell Scott (Richard Pryor) runs Georgia moonshine and becomes the first black NASCAR driver.

programme.title: Moving
programme.desc: A yuppie (Richard Pryor) loses his job in New Jersey and moves his wife (Beverly Todd) and family to Boise, Idaho.

programme.title: Bone: A Bad Day In Beverly Hills
programme.desc: A potential rapist (Yaphet Kotto) enters a Beverly Hills home and sends the husband (Andrew Duggan) to the bank while he stays with the wife (Joyce Van Patten).

programme.title: Women in Cages
programme.desc: A sadistic prison matron (Pam Grier) victimizes an innocent woman (Jennifer Gan), who is serving time for her lover's drug dealings.

programme.title: The Slams
programme.desc: Rival prison factions surround a Los Angeles convict (Jim Brown) who has $1.5 million stashed on the outside.

programme.title: The Deadly Art of Survival
programme.desc: A martial arts instructor struggles with drug dealers who are operating from a rival karate school called the Disco Dojo.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Passages from Frederick Douglass' greatest orations, dramatized by Arthur Bufghardt; performances by drummer Max Roach and his jazz ensemble; the J. C. White Singers.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Author James Baldwin is interviewed by the young Black poetess Nikki Giovanni; taped in London.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: The second installment in a special, two-part program featuring James Baldwin.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Featured guest Bill Withers sings hit single, "Ain't No Sunshine" and other selections from his album, "Just As I Am"; young poetess Mae Jackson reads from her own works.

programme.title: Winners and Sinners
programme.desc: Five criminals who have just been released from prison vow to never commit a crime again. However, after opening a cleaning company, they get entangled in a gang war.

programme.title: Melinda
programme.desc: An ex-girlfriend (Rosalind Cash) and a karate class help a disc jockey (Calvin Lockhart) avenge his slain girlfriend (Vonetta McGee).

programme.title: Cleopatra Jones
programme.desc: Federal agent Jones (Tamara Dobson) tries to rescue her framed boyfriend (Bernie Casey) from a drug-queen pervert known as Mommy (Shelley Winters).

programme.title: Brothers
programme.desc: An innocent black youth succumbs to the brutalities of prison after being duped into pleading guilty to robbery.

programme.title: ... Tick... Tick... Tick...
programme.desc: A newly elected sheriff (Jim Brown) gets help from his predecessor (George Kennedy) and the mayor (Fredric March) in a racially torn Southern town.
